intro: Apterosperma oblatum, commonly known as the flat-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Due to its drought tolerance, it is considered an important component of xerophytic ecosystems.
